newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spanish consul's house in Havana attacked - ministry.
newsitem.headline: Spanish consul's house in Havana attacked - ministry.

text.p: Unidentified assailants have vandalised the house of the Spanish consul in Havana, the Spanish Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday.
Tensions between the two countries have been high since Cuba last week withdrew approval for a new Spanish ambassador, accusing Madrid of interfering in its affairs.
"The house of the Spanish consul in Havana has been attacked last night," a Foreign Ministry official told Reuters.
The attackers punctured the tyres of the consul's car and stole a television antenna, the official said.
Spain asked Cuba last week to protect its embassy for fear of attacks after the rejection of its ambassador.
Cuban authorities placed a security cordon around the embassy, posting hundreds of police and plain-clothes guards outside to head off any disturbances.
